extendedInfo.description: Tower of Hanoi classic puzzle without anything extra.The objective of the puzzle is to move the entire stack to another base, obeying the following rules:- Only one disk may be moved at a time.- Each move consists of taking the upper disk from one of the bases and sliding it onto another base, on top of the other disks that may already be present on that base.- No disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk.SUPPORTVisit our Google+ page: http://goo.gl/Xxeb8or Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Celtic-Spear/290643634305314

reviews.title: Not drag n drop
reviews.comment: (1) Really tapping? Not drag n drop?!  (2) Numbers on disks are reversed. Logically, smallest disk should be the 1.  (3) The entire disk should be colored for easier visual cue.    I like the Tower of Hanoi Pro by noypiscripter better.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: So close to perfection
reviews.comment: By far the best Hanoi game on the store, but as others have said, the numbering system NEEDS to have larger numbers be larger blocks. Especially in later levels, it makes it nearly impossible to play because the smallest blocks change numbers every round.
reviews.author: Chris Sivanich

reviews.title: Cool
reviews.comment: Like alot
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Amazing game..
reviews.comment: I have fun playing this game wherever I go. Friends marvel at my amazing speed on this game since I learned a really cool method. I am never bored of this, and it is a good game to pass the time, yet the time never lets the game pass!  Great game.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: It works! :-)
reviews.comment: This old puzzle game works as it should.  Look for the pattern, there is an easy trick to it.  (Hint: think about even and odd stacks)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Nice implementation
reviews.comment: Sadly, this is a bit of a limited concept. Once you see the algorithm, it gets old quickly. It\'s all about combining smaller solutions to get the larger ones. A neat example of recursion, but as a game it\'s not all that exciting.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: I\'m not happy with the graphics,
reviews.comment: because the towers get bigger when selected, which is very confusing and makes you have to think of the numbers instead of the sizes, which is not the point in this game. Also, I think the pieces should be more different. The whole color could be different and not just the little stripes.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Best find in a while.
reviews.comment: Addicting, time consuming. Great game for down time.

reviews.title: 2^n-1 is the minimum moves
reviews.comment: Good game, but I think the numbering is back to front. 1 is smaller than 3, so you should be able to put it on top.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: The plates get bigger?
reviews.comment: When you click on a plate, it gets bigger to let you know that you selected it. Should have just highlighted the plate. The plates are numbered, but the size is pretty important. Would rate 0 if possible.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: It\'s alright
reviews.comment: It\'s a nice game, I guess. Just not my type.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Poor setup
reviews.comment: Don\'t download! This I\'d a waste of your time. Go download any other Hanoi app and it will be way better. You can\'t drag them to place them you have to select them then select where to move it. The numbers are backwards. When you select a piece it gets big so you don\'t know which ones are bigger than it.
reviews.author: Josh Hough
